message: i'm gone create data access layer for enterprise solutions and i'm using code first can u please tell me about ur Opinions thanks

data.message:
Don't! 

Use a proven existing data access layer or ORM that goes with whatever technology you are using.
why? i'm gone face bugs and don't know what's gone on

Facing bugs is a lot better than getting stuck for months in building a layer that people already have collectively built, enhanced and solved bugs for.

And you will end up having bugs yourself, but this time you will have wasted your project's time building a data access layer instead of building your project!
ok thanks for information but what the most preferred dal or orm do u like?

The ones I like are SQLAlchemy for Python and Doctrine for PHP, but the list is HUGE! You will need to do your own research :)

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_object-relational_mapping_software

There are many good alternatives. Back in the day NHibernate was the king, but now Entity Framework has grown "good enough" that I see this less and less. Some people use micro ORMs like Dapper and Peta Poco and even Massive but it's easier to manage EF in large scale.
I'd say don't use the migrations feature though. Can be a pain in large team, not very merge friendly (in source control terms). Use something like DbUp or FluentMigrator, etc.

Strongly recommend PetaPoco, it was selected in very large open source projects, which all trust, like umbraco & DNN.
Personally it's my main Tiny ORM
Mohamed Meligy i have heard the same words from you regarding ORMs tools since 4 years in code camp :)

At this time EF was still horrible. I used it in 2009 and regretted and became a big fan of NHibernate and threw a lot of weight in its community. Now EF although not great is very good for so many cases. I used it successfully in several projects. 

Migrations are not there still, they improved but main problems remained. Micro ORMs are improving greatly, but by definition or even name they are not for big teams. 

So, yes, this area of the world has been boring recently
